title: Faces of Austin - Antonelli's Cheese Shop
intro: This week on Faces of Austin, Nicki set out to learn more about one of her favorite subjects... CHEESE! She ended up at Antonelli’s Cheese Shop in Hyde Park, where she met with the manager, Jeanna Moreno. Nicki’s favorite cheese is Queso Fresco, and Jeanna’s favorite cheese is alma, a “kinda funky, garlicky washed-rind cheese” from Vermont.
caption1: If this post made you crave your favorite kind of cheese, call Antonelli’s and place an order for curbside pickup, but if you’re not sure what type of cheese you want, that’s okay too! “You can always learn so much more about cheese,” Jeanna says. “We pride ourselves on being accessible. Come see us, and we can definitely help you find what you like.”

title: Faces of Austin - Julio's Cafe
intro: This week on Faces of Austin, we’re checking out Julio’s Cafe on Duval! Just ten minutes north of campus, Julio’s Cafe has been serving everything from breakfast tacos to enchiladas to their famous rotisserie chicken since 1983.
caption1: They had to close their dining areas due to the pandemic, but they’ve just reopened their patio to the public. We met with Julio himself, who’s father and grandmother founded the restaurant when he was growing up in Austin. He takes pride in serving the best chicken in Austin with a smile on his face (the mask is covering it up in the video, but trust is, it’s there!)

title: Faces of Austin – Waterloo Records
intro: This week on Faces of Austin Nicki met with Liam at Waterloo Records at 600 N Lamar St. A staple of Austin’s music scene for nearly 40 years, Waterloo has won the Austin Music Award for Best Record Store every year since 1982.
caption1: Bring some friends and have fun browsing their treasure trove of records and memorabilia, but before you go, be sure to make an appointment at waterloorecords.com— capacity is limited due to the pandemic.

title: Faces of Austin – Cane and Abels
intro: This week on Faces of Austin, Hank checked out @cainandabels an iconic West Campus bar. Elliott and Hank talked about being a part of the Austin community, drinking safely during the pandemic, and of course, Texas football.
caption1: Come to Cain and Abel’s on W 24th to watch Texas take on West Virginia this Saturday at 11 am, or if you’re over 21, come on a Tuesday or Thursday to try their famous Texas Tea for only $7. And hey @dickerthekicker watch out— Elliott might be coming for your job.

title: Faces of Austin – Wooten Barbershop
intro: This week on Faces of Austin, Hank went to Wooten Barbershop for a haircut appointment with Doug. Doug mentioned that after nearly sixty years of business, Wooten had just reached an important milestone: they made an Instagram!
caption1: Luckily, Hank had his camera on him to document this momentous occasion. Hank says “I’ve been getting my hair cut at Wooten since the first month of my freshman year. Doug, Ralph, Don, and the rest of the guys are super friendly and love students — if you still haven’t hacked off your pandemic scruff, they’ll fix you up.” Wooten Barbershop is an iconic part of the drag, make sure to support then during this difficult time!

title: Faces of Austin – Busy Bean Cafe
intro: This week on Faces of Austin, Lily met with the owner of Busy Bean Cafe, UT student Alyssa Torres. Alyssa has just began her journey as a business owner, starting out of her apartment at Lark.
caption1: Although Busy Bean Cafe is still fairly new, it has become very popular due to its prime location in the heart of West Campus. Busy Bean Cafe offers a variety of coffee, as well as occasional delicious baked goods. Alyssa hopes to grow her company into a coffee truck or shop in the future.
caption2: Although still a rookie business owner, Alyssa shows passion and pride in making the products she sells the best possible. Lily ordered the matcha latte, and it was delicious! Make sure to check out @busy.bean.cafe for information on order and pick up!

title: Faces of Austin – Growler USA
intro: This week on Faces of Austin, Sophie ventured down Guad and interviewed Sam at Growler USA. Growler is a Microbrew pub on the outskirts of west campus. It is a great place to try over 100 different beers on tap, meet up with friends and grab a bite to eat.
caption1: In addition to the beer, Growler also has delicious food. They have 6$ flatbread pizzas on Fridays and Sam mentions that he even has an entrée named after him: The Sam Special (Turkey club with mayo, tomatoes and pepper jack cheese)!

title: Faces of Austin – Lick it Up
intro: This week on Faces of Austin Sophie found a treat for all our vegan and vegetarian followers... Lick it Up, a food truck that serves vegan renditions of all your Mexican street food favorites! There are two locations, one behind Spiderhouse at W 29th St and Guad, and one on Rainey. Go try the seitan carne asada fries or the tortas, and while you’re there, mention you’re from ACP!

title: Faces of Austin – Hay Elotes
intro: This week for our Faces of Austin series, Ian took us to meet Emma and Abigail, two of the cooks at Hay Elotes on E 7th St! Hay Elotes is local favorite that serves antojitos (Mexican street food) including their famous elotes.
caption1: Once part of Austin’s segregated district, East Austin is now one of the city’s biggest and most diverse neighborhoods, and it’s home to a variety of cultural and historical landmarks. Huston-Tillotson University, a historically black university just around the corner from Hay Elotes, is the oldest university in the city (it was founded 8 years before UT!). A few blocks north, you can check out Victory Grill, one of the last remaining music halls from the Chitlin’ Circuit, where legendary artists like Chuck Berry, James Brown, and Tina Turner once performed to packed crowds.
caption2: If you’re looking for a fun way to spend a socially-distanced Saturday, you should head down to East Austin and learn about the history behind some of our city’s lesser-known treasure troves-- and be sure to stop by Hay Elotes and grab a tasty treat while you’re there! Check out our story for the full interview with Emma and Abigail, and follow us for more Faces of Austin every Wednesday!
